dives.notes: Amazing dive at Shark & Yolanda! Saw two scalloped hammerheads cruising along the wall. Napoleon wrasse followed us for most of the dive. Large school of barracuda at 18m. The Yolanda cargo is still photogenic with toilet fixtures scattered around. Strong current on the return but manageable. Incredible coral coverage and colors.

Second dive of the day at Ras Mohammed. Strong current made it challenging but worth it - saw a spotted eagle ray gliding near the wall at 25m. Massive school of barracuda (100+) formed a wall. Two green turtles munching on soft corals. The wall is absolutely stunning with colorful soft corals. Had to use reef hook at one point. Visibility dropped slightly compared to morning. Great dive!

First dive at Richelieu Rock - Thailand's best! No whale sharks today but incredible macro life. Saw 3 harlequin shrimp, 2 ornate ghost pipefish, and countless nudibranchs. Tomato anemonefish were very territorial. Large school of barracuda on the north side. Visibility was good despite plankton. Surface interval revealed manta ray cruising by - missed it underwater! Will definitely come back.

meta.purpose: Mock dive logs for testing history and detail views
